intro: Hieracium macrotonum subsp. smolandicum, commonly known as the Svalbard hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its clustered, yellowish-green flowering heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
